Title: SDSS-IV MaNGA: Cannibalism Caught in the Act - on the Frequency of 
       Occurrence of Multiple Cores in Brightest Cluster Galaxies 
Authors: Hsu Y.-H., Lin Y.-T., Huang S., Nelson D., Rodriguez-Gomez V., 
         Lai H.-T., Greene J., Leauthaud A., Aragon-Salamanca A., Bundy K., 
         Emsellem E., Merrifield M., More S., Okabe N., Rong Y., 
         Brownstein J.R., Lane R.R., Pan K., Schneider D.P. 
Table: The 128 BCGs in the MPL-9 sample
================================================================================
Byte-by-byte Description of file: apjac6d66t2_mrt.txt
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   Bytes Format Units     Label   Explanations
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1-  4 I4     ---       ID      Internal identifier from this work
   6- 16 F11.7  deg       RAdeg   Right Ascension in decimal degrees (J2000)
  18- 28 F11.8  deg       DEdeg   Declination in decimal degrees (J2000)
  30- 38 F9.7   ---       z       The catalog redshift (1)
  40- 44 F5.2   [solMass] logM    log Halo mass
  46- 56 A11    ---       MaNGA   MaNGA plate-ifu identifier
      58 I1     ---       Select  Selection flag (2)
      60 I1     ---       Phot    Photometry source (3)
      62 I1     ---       IFU18   IFU coverage (4)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Note (G1) The 79 BCGs in the Main sample can be selected by setting the
          Select flag to 1 and the IFU18 flag to 1.
Note (1): From Y07 [2007ApJ...671..153Y]. For the changed BCGs mentioned in 
          Section B.3, from SDSS or MaNGA.
Note (2): The 115 BCGs described in Section 2.1 have this flag set to 1.
Note (3): 
    0 = The Ellipse-based Sersic fittting mentioned in Section 3.1 
        and Section A.
    1 = Meert et al. (2016) [2016MNRAS.455.2440M].
    2 = Fischer et al. (2019) [2019MNRAS.483.2057F] (see Section A).
Note (4): Set to 1 if the IFU coverage is at least 18kpc
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
